meanings.definition: Of the nature of a portent
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds in the sky had a portentousness that made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The eerie silence in the haunted house added a sense of portentousness to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sudden meow had a portentousness that made the dog jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The old clock's ticking had a portentousness as if it held the secrets of time itself.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look had a portentousness that warned the students of an upcoming test.

meanings.sent1: The sudden drop in temperature was a portentousness of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The politician's cryptic smile held a sense of portentousness about the upcoming announcement.
meanings.sent3: The chef's burnt toast was a portentousness of the disastrous meal to come.
meanings.sent4: The eerie howling of the wind carried a portentousness of impending danger.
meanings.sent5: The broken mirror's reflection had a portentousness that hinted at bad luck ahead.
